center.h5:
Due to Governor Parson's recent order, Moberly Public Schools will remain closed
to in-person classes for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.

div.div:
Parent Letter Regarding Grades During COVID-19 School Closure!
On March 17, Moberly School District announced the closure of its schools effective at the end of the day in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Chromebooks went home with students, and plans were in place to utilize eLearning for student enrichment and learning opportunities during the closure. Now as we face eLearning through the end of the school year, a second semester grading plan is necessary. Moberly School District teachers will follow the guidelines outlined in the parent letter below for second semester grading. Click on the link below to download the parent letter.
Parent Letter Regarding Grades
Date Posted: April 11, 2020

div.blockquote:
“If you can’t find light in the darkness, be the light in the darkness.”
We celebrate our seniors as the are the bright lights shining right now. Keep your heads up #Classof2020
We got you! #SpartanPride pic.twitter.com/XvrcdIqdGq— Moberly High School (@MoberlyHS) April 11, 2020

div.div:
Spartan Clinic Update!
Clarity Healthcare and the Moberly School District understand the importance of continuity of care for medical services and behavioral health services for the students and staff of the school district.
Spartan Clinic will continue to operate as normal, but will be in a new (temporary) location at the Gratz Brown Elementary School at 1320 Gratz Brown Road. Patients will enter the clinic using the exterior door south of the main entrance of Gratz Brown Elementary. Call the numbers below for appointment availability and triaging Monday through Friday 8 a.m. to 4 p.m.
To learn more about the services offered a the new (temporary) location, please go to the COVID-19 Information Page.
Date Posted: April 3, 2020

North Park Teacher Parade!
On Monday, March 30th, the North Park Elementary Staff held a Teacher parade throughout their school's neighborhoods. Check out their pictures and even video of this fun event on the North Park Elementary Facebook page by clicking on the link below.
North Park Elementary Facebook Page
Date Posted: April 3, 2020

div.blockquote: @MoberlyHS's production of "The Beverly Hillbillies" may not have opened tonight, but we're still rehearsing, waiting for our postponement to be scheduled! #SpartanPride pic.twitter.com/6HwRisdMDw— MHS Theatrical Arts (@mhs_arts) April 2, 2020

div.h4: Nutrition Services: Thank you for serving our students!
div.blockquote: Volunteers from @MoberlyDistrict, Caring Communities, & Opaa! staff provided 250+ drive-through, grab & go meals to children 18 & under today. We maintained social distancing, so no selfie group pic! We'll continue to #BeBraveLearners & rally together to support our community. pic.twitter.com/Bfj4NO8ski— Dr. Matthew S Miller (@DrMattSMiller) March 23, 2020

MPS and OPAA employees helped to provide over 100 meals today at North Park. It was nice to see so many people helping students and their families. It's all about helping people right now. pic.twitter.com/8EFx2ZoMtV— North Park Principal (@park_principal) March 23, 2020
We're thankful for teachers like you @JeanaCH https://t.co/Ass8HbrvOW— MoberlyMiddleSchool (@moberlymiddle) March 19, 2020

div.div:
Mission Moberly Strategic Plan During the 2017 - 2018 school year, the Mission Moberly Leadership team worked collaboratively with stakeholders throughout the Moberly Community to create the Mission Moberly Strategic Plan. Click on the image above to download and view the Mission Moberly Strategic Plan.
As the Mission Moberly Strategic Plan is implemented, we will provide updates on the Goals, Priorities and Indicators within the plan. Click on the link below to see our progress using the Mission Moberly Dashboard.
Mission Moberly Dashboard
Date Posted: August 26, 2019

img.alt: MSD Climate Survey Icon: We're Listening to You Changing our Survey (it's shorter!) & Improving our schools

div.br:
Moberly School District Climate Survey!
Thank you, parents, students and staff! We appreciate you completing the Climate Survey for the third year in a row. This continuous feedback gives us information we need to celebrate our growths to enhance our school climate.
Almost 2,200 Spartans completed the survey this year. And, now we have three years of information to look for trends. Click on the link below to go to the 2019 Climate Survey page to see the initial results from the 2019 Climate Survey.
2019 Climate Survey Info
Date Posted: August 15, 2019
